author: .vbuterin
content: Mainly just easy tools for doing it quickly (ie. doing an entire aggregation tree of SNARKs in like 1-4 seconds)

author: samwilsn
content:
Reading list from today's call:

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4337 - ERC-4337 Account Abstraction Using Alt Mempool
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7562 - ERC-7562 Account Abstraction Validation Scope Rules
https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/blob/master/RIPS/rip-7560.md - RIP-7560 Native Account Abstraction

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3074 - EIP-3074 AUTH and AUTHCALL opcodes
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5003 - EIP-5003 Insert Code into EOAs with AUTHUSURP

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5806 - EIP-5806 Delegate transaction

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7377 - EIP-7377 Migration Transaction

https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7949 - EIP-7553 Separated Payer Transaction

author: lightclient
content: One question on 7560, are the mempool rules listed in erc-7562 supposed to be required by core clients? https://github.com/ethereum/ercs/blob/master/ERCS/erc-7562.md

author: lightclient
content: in other words, what is the minimal thing core clients can do w.r.t. the mempool
